alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Franklin; Hancock; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 27 at 2:55PM CST until January 28 at 9:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Band of Moderate to Heavy Snowfall Late Tonight into Saturday... .A relatively narrow band of moderate to heavy snowfall will develop late tonight and persist into Saturday over the northern half of Iowa. Amounts will be heaviest north of Highway 20 with a quick drop off in amounts on the southern side of the snowfall. The precipitation is likely to diminish later Saturday and may be mixed with freezing drizzle at times. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 PM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Areas of blowing snow are also expected with increasing northeast to north winds on Saturday. * WHERE...Much of north central Iowa. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow and heavy falling snowfall could significantly reduce visibility. Cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief period of freezing drizzle may follow the heavier snowfall which may prolong travel difficulties.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.

area.areaDesc: Cerro Gordo; Franklin; Hancock; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Wright
